s.text: But Russia hasn't explained how these differ from ones employed previously, and the paper doesn't seem to know either.
Yesterday morning, says an LAT front-pager, a man was killed in a shootout with police officers after he lead them on a three-hour freeway car chase.
Yesterday morning, says an LAT front-pager, a man was killed in a shootout with police officers after he lead them on a three-hour freeway car chase.
Yesterday morning, says an LAT front-pager, a man was killed in a shootout with police officers after he lead them on a three-hour freeway car chase.
The stations defended themselves by arguing that they could have showed close-ups of the killing but refrained from doing so.
The LAT reminds readers that in 1996, 1,500 Chechen fighters were able to seize back their capital from 12,000 Russian troops, and that this humiliating defeat is fueling Russia's current ferocity.
